headline: Wall Street closes lower as AI funding jitters drag tech stocks
summary: STORY: Wall Street's main indexes closed lower on Wednesday, with the Dow dropping nearly half a percent, the S&P 500 shedding more than 1% and the Nasdaq losing 1.8%.Shares of Oracle dropped nearly 5.5% after a report said the company's largest data center partner, Blue Owl Capital, will not back a $10 billion deal for its next AI-related facility.Adam Coons is chief investment officer at Winthrop Capital Management."In particular today, the story is around Oracle, the continued buildout, and then the fact that Blue Owl, who's been prevalent with some other deals with AI stories, actually did not participate in Oracle's equity offering surrounding their buildout of their data center up in Michigan. So that got markets just a little bit worried about, you know, kind of the growing angst around growing debt to fund all of this AI infrastructure build.”Worries about the technology sector taking on more debt to develop AI have discouraged risk-taking lately.Shares of AI bellwether Nvidia fell nearly 4% on Wednesday, and fellow chipmaker Broadcom dropped 4.5%.Shares of Amazon also closed lower after reports said the company is in talks to invest about $10 billion in ChatGPT maker OpenAI.On the flip side, shares of Micron Technology rose as much as 14% in extended trading, before paring some of those gains, after the company forecast second-quarter profit well above Wall Street estimates, buoyed by soaring prices for memory chips and booming demand from AI data centers.

raw.headline: Wall Street closes lower as AI funding jitters drag tech stocks
raw.summary: STORY: Wall Street's main indexes closed lower on Wednesday, with the Dow dropping nearly half a percent, the S&P 500 shedding more than 1% and the Nasdaq losing 1.8%.Shares of Oracle dropped nearly 5.5% after a report said the company's largest data center partner, Blue Owl Capital, will not back a $10 billion deal for its next AI-related facility.Adam Coons is chief investment officer at Winthrop Capital Management."In particular today, the story is around Oracle, the continued buildout, and then the fact that Blue Owl, who's been prevalent with some other deals with AI stories, actually did not participate in Oracle's equity offering surrounding their buildout of their data center up in Michigan. So that got markets just a little bit worried about, you know, kind of the growing angst around growing debt to fund all of this AI infrastructure build.”Worries about the technology sector taking on more debt to develop AI have discouraged risk-taking lately.Shares of AI bellwether Nvidia fell nearly 4% on Wednesday, and fellow chipmaker Broadcom dropped 4.5%.Shares of Amazon also closed lower after reports said the company is in talks to invest about $10 billion in ChatGPT maker OpenAI.On the flip side, shares of Micron Technology rose as much as 14% in extended trading, before paring some of those gains, after the company forecast second-quarter profit well above Wall Street estimates, buoyed by soaring prices for memory chips and booming demand from AI data centers.

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Another AI Selloff
summary: The Dow fell 228 points led by Caterpillar and Nvidia.  The PHLX Semiconductor Index that is home to 30 major chip stocks dropped 3.8% by the closing bell.  Nvidia, Broadcom, Tesla and Google-parent Alphabet all shed 3-4% by the closing bell, racking up a total of $431 billion in lost market cap for the day.

raw.headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Another AI Selloff

Nvidia, Broadcom, Tesla and Google-parent Alphabet all shed 3-4% by the closing bell, racking up a total of $431 billion in lost market cap for the day.

headline: AI-Themed Stocks Take More Hits, Sending Nasdaq Lower
summary: Tech stocks slid on Wednesday, continuing to drag down major indexes, as investors worried about the future of AI-themed stocks.  The Nasdaq Composite Index dropped 1.8%, while the S&P 500 slipped 1.2%, the biggest falls for each benchmark in nearly a month.  Tech giants Google-parent  Alphabet Nvidia  and  Tesla  all fell more than 3%, leading the Magnificent Seven growth stocks lower, while the Dow industrials fell 0.5%, dragged lower by a fall in  Caterpillar  shares.

raw.headline: AI-Themed Stocks Take More Hits, Sending Nasdaq Lower

Tech giants Google-parent  Alphabet Nvidia  and  Tesla  all fell more than 3%, leading the Magnificent Seven growth stocks lower, while the Dow industrials fell 0.5%, dragged lower by a fall in  Caterpillar  shares.

headline: Oracle slides on AI overpromise, says market expert
summary: STORY: Shares of Oracle fell nearly 5% after a report said the cloud company's largest data center partner Blue Owl Capital will not back a $10 billion deal for its next AI data center facility.Coons said the pullback also reflects a normal repricing process rather than signs of a broader AI bubble."I think this is really healthy for all those that talk about a AI bubble, I think this proves that there isn't one because this is so much different than the dotcom bubble, because there are healthy discussions and healthy pullbacks like this for certain names that probably deserve it," he said.

raw.headline: Oracle slides on AI overpromise, says market expert
raw.summary: STORY: Shares of Oracle fell nearly 5% after a report said the cloud company's largest data center partner Blue Owl Capital will not back a $10 billion deal for its next AI data center facility.Coons said the pullback also reflects a normal repricing process rather than signs of a broader AI bubble."I think this is really healthy for all those that talk about a AI bubble, I think this proves that there isn't one because this is so much different than the dotcom bubble, because there are healthy discussions and healthy pullbacks like this for certain names that probably deserve it," he said.

headline: Nasdaq tumbles on renewed angst over AI building boom
summary: Tech shares suffered another bout of weakness Wednesday on worries about an AI bubble, hitting US stocks as oil prices advanced following a US announcement of a blockade of tankers to Venezuela.Oil prices rallied after US President Donald Trump ordered a blockade of "sanctioned" oil tankers heading to and leaving Venezuela.

raw.headline: Nasdaq tumbles on renewed angst over AI building boom
raw.summary: Tech shares suffered another bout of weakness Wednesday on worries about an AI bubble, hitting US stocks as oil prices advanced following a US announcement of a blockade of tankers to Venezuela.Oil prices rallied after US President Donald Trump ordered a blockade of "sanctioned" oil tankers heading to and leaving Venezuela.

headline: Salesforce and Other AI Stocks That Can Catch Up to the Pack
summary: Nvidia Microsoft  and other prominent artificial-intelligence stocks are seeing bouts of selling.  Wall Street has grown wary that software and internet companies will slow down the pace of their investments in data centers, dragging down chip stocks.  The worry there is that returns on their massive AI investments might disappoint the market’s expectations.
